newsitem.title: JAPAN: NEC says to set up chip joint venture in China.
newsitem.headline: NEC says to set up chip joint venture in China.

text.p: NEC Corp said on Thursday that it had agreed with Shanghai Hua Hong Microelectronics Co Ltd to set up a joint venture in China to produce semiconductor chips.
"We have agreed on a joint venture and expect a formal signing of the agreement in the near future, probably by the end of this month," an NEC spokesman said.
The partner is affiliated with China's Electronics Industry Ministry, the NEC spokesman said.
The venture will be capitalised at about $700 million and NEC will hold a 30 percent stake in it, the spokesman said.
The venture will produce various memory chips using 0.5 to 0.35 micron technology, he said.
The venture is expected to start operations around 1998 or 1999, he said.
The venture will be capable of producing the equivalent of 20,000 eight-inch wafers a month, he said.

Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun said on Thursday that the venture was part of China's $1 billion national microchip project in which the Chinese government was seeking participation of semiconductor makers in Japan, the United States and Europe.
